Bulbasaur.pokedex_entry: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

Ivysaur.pokedex_entry: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

Venusaur.pokedex_entry: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

Charmander.pokedex_entry: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

Charmeleon.pokedex_entry: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

Charizard.pokedex_entry: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

Squirtle.pokedex_entry: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

Wartortle.pokedex_entry: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

Blastoise.pokedex_entry: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.

Caterpie.pokedex_entry: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

Metapod.pokedex_entry: This Pokémon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

Butterfree.pokedex_entry: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

Weedle.pokedex_entry: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.

Kakuna.pokedex_entry: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

Beedrill.pokedex_entry: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

Pidgey.pokedex_entry: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

Pidgeotto.pokedex_entry: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

Pidgeot.pokedex_entry: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as MAGIKARP.

Rattata.pokedex_entry: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

Raticate.pokedex_entry: It uses its whis- kers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.

Spearow.pokedex_entry: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

Fearow.pokedex_entry: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

Ekans.pokedex_entry: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole.

Arbok.pokedex_entry: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

Pikachu.pokedex_entry: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

Raichu.pokedex_entry: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

Sandshrew.pokedex_entry: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

Sandslash.pokedex_entry: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

Nidoran♀.pokedex_entry: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

Nidorina.pokedex_entry: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

Nidoqueen.pokedex_entry: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

Nidoran♂.pokedex_entry: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

Nidorino.pokedex_entry: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

Nidoking.pokedex_entry: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.

Clefairy.pokedex_entry: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

Clefable.pokedex_entry: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

Vulpix.pokedex_entry: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

Ninetales.pokedex_entry: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

Jigglypuff.pokedex_entry: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

Wigglytuff.pokedex_entry: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

Zubat.pokedex_entry: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

Golbat.pokedex_entry: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

Oddish.pokedex_entry: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

Gloom.pokedex_entry: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

Vileplume.pokedex_entry: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

Paras.pokedex_entry: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by draw- ing nutrients from the bug host.

Parasect.pokedex_entry: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

Venonat.pokedex_entry: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

Venomoth.pokedex_entry: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

Diglett.pokedex_entry: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

Dugtrio.pokedex_entry: A team of DIGLETT triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

Meowth.pokedex_entry: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

Persian.pokedex_entry: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

Psyduck.pokedex_entry: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

Golduck.pokedex_entry: Often seen swim- ming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

Mankey.pokedex_entry: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.

Primeape.pokedex_entry: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.

Growlithe.pokedex_entry: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

Arcanine.pokedex_entry: A Pokémon that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

Poliwag.pokedex_entry: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

Poliwhirl.pokedex_entry: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

Poliwrath.pokedex_entry: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

Abra.pokedex_entry: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and TELEPORT to safety.

Kadabra.pokedex_entry: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

Alakazam.pokedex_entry: Its brain can out- perform a super- computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

Machop.pokedex_entry: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

Machoke.pokedex_entry: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

Machamp.pokedex_entry: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

Bellsprout.pokedex_entry: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

Weepinbell.pokedex_entry: It spits out POISONPOWDER to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of ACID.

Victreebel.pokedex_entry: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

Tentacool.pokedex_entry: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

Tentacruel.pokedex_entry: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

Geodude.pokedex_entry: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

Graveler.pokedex_entry: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

Golem.pokedex_entry: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

Ponyta.pokedex_entry: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.

Rapidash.pokedex_entry: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

Slowpoke.pokedex_entry: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

Slowbro.pokedex_entry: The SHELLDER that is latched onto SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.

Magnemite.pokedex_entry: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves.

Magneton.pokedex_entry: Formed by several MAGNEMITEs linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

Farfetch'd.pokedex_entry: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

Doduo.pokedex_entry: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

Dodrio.pokedex_entry: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

Seel.pokedex_entry: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

Dewgong.pokedex_entry: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

Grimer.pokedex_entry: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

Muk.pokedex_entry: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

Shellder.pokedex_entry: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

Cloyster.pokedex_entry: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

Gastly.pokedex_entry: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

Haunter.pokedex_entry: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from an- other dimension.

Gengar.pokedex_entry: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

Onix.pokedex_entry: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

Drowzee.pokedex_entry: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

Hypno.pokedex_entry: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION.

Krabby.pokedex_entry: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

Kingler.pokedex_entry: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

Voltorb.pokedex_entry: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Pokéball, they have zapped many people.

Electrode.pokedex_entry: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

Exeggcute.pokedex_entry: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

Exeggutor.pokedex_entry: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an EXEGGCUTE.

Cubone.pokedex_entry: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.

Marowak.pokedex_entry: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

Hitmonlee.pokedex_entry: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

Hitmonchan.pokedex_entry: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.

Lickitung.pokedex_entry: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.

Koffing.pokedex_entry: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

Weezing.pokedex_entry: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.

Rhyhorn.pokedex_entry: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

Rhydon.pokedex_entry: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.

Chansey.pokedex_entry: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

Tangela.pokedex_entry: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to sea- weed. Its vines shake as it walks.

Kangaskhan.pokedex_entry: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.

Horsea.pokedex_entry: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

Seadra.pokedex_entry: Capable of swim- ming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

Goldeen.pokedex_entry: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

Seaking.pokedex_entry: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming power- fully up rivers and creeks.

Staryu.pokedex_entry: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

Starmie.pokedex_entry: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

Mr.Mime.pokedex_entry: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

Scyther.pokedex_entry: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

Jynx.pokedex_entry: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

Electabuzz.pokedex_entry: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

Magmar.pokedex_entry: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

Pinsir.pokedex_entry: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

Tauros.pokedex_entry: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

Magikarp.pokedex_entry: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

Gyarados.pokedex_entry: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

Lapras.pokedex_entry: A Pokémon that has been over- hunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.

Ditto.pokedex_entry: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

Eevee.pokedex_entry: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element STONEs.

Vaporeon.pokedex_entry: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

Jolteon.pokedex_entry: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000- volt lightning bolts.

Flareon.pokedex_entry: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

Porygon.pokedex_entry: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

Omanyte.pokedex_entry: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

Omastar.pokedex_entry: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.

Kabuto.pokedex_entry: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

Kabutops.pokedex_entry: Its sleek shape is perfect for swim- ming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

Aerodactyl.pokedex_entry: A ferocious, pre- historic Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

Snorlax.pokedex_entry: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

Articuno.pokedex_entry: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

Zapdos.pokedex_entry: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

Moltres.pokedex_entry: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

Dratini.pokedex_entry: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

Dragonair.pokedex_entry: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

Dragonite.pokedex_entry: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

Mewtwo.pokedex_entry: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

Mew.pokedex_entry: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
